terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: Max Planck Institute for Plant Breeding Research

description: To optimize growth and development, plants monitor photosynthetic activities and regulate various cellular processes accordingly. However, signaling mechanisms that coordinate plant growth with photosynthesis remain poorly understood. To identify factors that are involved in this coordination, we performed a phosphoproteomic analysis with Marchantia polymorpha, an extant bryophyte species in the basal lineage of land plants.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Marchantia polymorpha, Phosphoproteomics, Blue light, DCMU

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Koide E, Suetsugu N, Iwano M, Gotoh E, Nomura Y, Stolze SC, Nakagami H, Kohchi T, Nishihama R Regulation of Photosynthetic Carbohydrate Metabolism by a Raf-Like Kinase in the Liverwort Marchantia polymorpha. Plant Cell Physiol. 2019 Dec 18;

title: Phosphoproteomics of Marchantia polymorpha upon Blue light and DCMU treatments
